column4: Does anyone know why, whenever I ssh to my friend's debian box, it's really slow. Both of us have broadband. Is this a known issue or something? How do I speed it up
slow how?  command line not responsive?
throughput must exist end to end.  Broadband at both ends doesn't help if there's a bottleneck between.
It's like when I type "sethk" .. after 5 seconds, it starts with write word by word "sethk"
I assume you mean letter by letter
try running ping for a while, see what the round trips are.
sorry, your right. letter by letter.
We're in opposite of the earth.
latency would be high, cause he's in florida, and I'm currently in United Arab Emirates.
true, but it will still be useful, especially after the first few packets.
you can run some test programs, but all that will tell you is what you already know.
try a traceroute, see if that might give any clues.
isn't that replaced by tracepath? heh.
not for me, I'm a dinosaur  :)
Anywho, I can connect , no problem.. but it's just lagging ..
Anywho, I can connect , no problem.. but it's just lagging ..
